name: Marathon Eryri (Snowdonia Marathon)

difficulty.label: Extreme
difficulty.technical: Moderate - Mixed road and trail surfaces

description: The 42nd edition of Marathon Eryri is one of Britain's most iconic and challenging road marathons, weaving through the spectacular heart of Snowdonia National Park. Starting in the mountain village of Llanberis, runners climb to Pen y Pass (1,100ft) before descending through Beddgelert and tackling the punishing Bwlch y Groes climb. The route showcases Wales' most dramatic sceneryâ€”rugged mountain peaks, ancient slate quarries, and pristine valleys. This isn't a PB course; it's a test of character. With 12 feed stations, legendary crowd support, and a heroes' welcome back in Llanberis, Marathon Eryri delivers an unforgettable experience for runners who want more than a flat, fast race. Perfect for experienced marathoners seeking adventure over speed.
who_its_for: Experienced marathoners seeking a challenging mountain course with spectacular scenery. Not recommended for first-time marathoners or those chasing personal bests.
whats_special: One of the UK's most scenic marathon routes

entry.notes: Places allocated by ballot only. Transfers available March 1 - September 30, 2026.
